title: Repo sync
author: docs-bot
details: Updated GitHub Marketplace app listing requirements: replaced specific Terms of Service link requirement with broader rules for all additional links.
Added `code-quality` as an allowed value for CTA `ref_product` in the style guide.
Added tracking query parameters (`ref_product`, `ref_type`, etc.) to numerous internal and external URLs.
Reordered content in the "create a PR" article, moving the "New repository" entrypoint lower.
Added an example configuration for GitHub MCP in Coding Agent documentation to enable wider access.
summary:

- Reordered content in the "create a PR" article, moving the "New repository" entrypoint lower.
- Added an example configuration for GitHub MCP in Coding Agent documentation to enable wider access.

original_description:
This is an automated pull request to sync changes between the public and private repos.
Our bot will merge this pull request automatically.
To preserve continuity across repos, _do not squash_ this pull request.
raw_analysis:
Here's a concise summary of the Pull Request changes:

### Summary
- Updated GitHub Marketplace app listing requirements: replaced specific Terms of Service link requirement with broader rules for all additional links.
- Added `code-quality` as an allowed value for CTA `ref_product` in the style guide.
- Added tracking query parameters (`ref_product`, `ref_type`, etc.) to numerous internal and external URLs.
- Reordered content in the "create a PR" article, moving the "New repository" entrypoint lower.
- Added an example configuration for GitHub MCP in Coding Agent documentation to enable wider access.

### Title
Update app listing rules, CTAs, tracking, PR content, and MCP config
